sub_title: M.Sc. Forensic Psychology | University Teacher, Meditation Instructor, Writer & Speaker | All for the reconnection with our conscious, compassionate and pro-social selves.
summary:
I am a forensic psychologist, by training, with a specialisation in child and youth mental health and a focus on preventive approaches to aggressive and anti-social behaviour. Thus, my background lies in child welfare and systemic therapy intervention and consultation.

In recent years, my work shifted from prevention approaches to the active promotion of conscious, compassionate, and pro-social behaviour. Thus, I’ve increasingly engaged with holistic approaches to individual and group well-being, mainly informed by Positive and Humanistic Psychology as well as evidence-based Mindfulness and Compassion practices.

In addition, I started my own community project for a more grounded lifestyle with the aim to foster a co-created, intergenerational and regenerative living space. Here, we aim to establish supportive connections with the ‘self‘, other like-minded individuals and our climate consciousness through applied practices of meditation, open communication and regeneration.

In the past, I worked with forensic adult clinical populations, criminal youth and early childhood adversity. I also worked as an Education Officer and Teaching Fellow at an interdisciplinary Liberal Arts and Science University College within a problem-based educational framework. 

Finally, I am a spoken word artist, writing and performing poetry and prosa in English and German. Increasingly, I also collaborate with other artists including poets, musicians and illustrators and host my own poetry show called CONNECT in Barcelona. My artist name is sophia saggezza (@so4.poesia).

I am extremely passionate about creating real possibilities for the necessary reconnection to our authentic, pro-social selves so to enable consicous mindsets and compassionate communication and action for a sustainable future.
